security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and Python calculation scripts for financial modeling and strategic analysis. The static scanner produced false positives by detecting backticks in markdown templates (not shell commands), YAML frontmatter patterns (not crypto algorithms), and business terminology like 'competitive intelligence' (not security reconnaissance). All Python code performs local mathematical calculations with no network calls, external command execution, or credential access.

content.user_title: Guide strategic decisions with executive frameworks
content.value_statement: CEOs face complex decisions about growth, governance, and stakeholder management. This skill provides structured frameworks for strategic planning, financial modeling, board governance, and investor relations to support executive-level decision-making.
actual_capabilities: Analyze strategic position using SWOT, Porter's Five Forces, and BCG Matrix frameworks
Model financial scenarios with NPV, IRR, sensitivity analysis, and risk-adjusted projections
Generate strategic options with implementation roadmaps and priority recommendations
Prepare board materials including governance structures, meeting protocols, and communication templates
Guide investor relations with earnings call scripts, messaging frameworks, and shareholder communication strategies
Develop organizational culture and leadership capabilities using proven transformation frameworks
limitations: Assumes public company governance structures; may need adaptation for private companies
Industry-specific nuances require manual customization by the user
Does not connect to real-time market data; input data must be provided manually
Financial projections use simplified models; professional validation recommended for major decisions

use_cases.title: Strategic Planning Cycles
use_cases.description: Prepare quarterly board presentations with financial projections and strategic initiative updates

use_cases.title: Board Package Assembly
use_cases.description: Structure board materials following governance best practices and communication templates

use_cases.title: Due Diligence Support
use_cases.description: Evaluate company strategic position using structured analysis frameworks

prompt_templates.title: Quick Strategic Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze our strategic position using SWOT and Porter's Five Forces. Company data: market share 25%, brand strength 70%, revenue growth 15%, profitability 20%, customer loyalty 65%.

prompt_templates.title: Financial Projection
prompt_templates.prompt: Model three financial scenarios for the next 3 years: aggressive growth (50% revenue increase), moderate growth (25%), and conservative (10% reduction). Base case: 5M revenue, 2M cash, 200K monthly burn.

prompt_templates.title: Board Preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a board meeting preparation checklist including agenda items, CEO report structure, financial dashboard metrics, and strategic update sections for quarterly review.

prompt_templates.title: Investor Communication
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft key messages for an earnings call covering Q3 performance including growth trajectory, competitive position, financial highlights, and forward guidance for a SaaS company.

output_examples.input: Analyze our strategic position. Company data: market share 30%, brand strength 75%, revenue growth 35%, profitability 25%, customer loyalty 70%. Competition is high, industry disruption is occurring.
output: Strategic Pillars: Market Position 71.3 (Strong), Financial Health 53.8 (Adequate), Organizational Capability 67.5 (Strong)
Top Strategic Options: Digital Transformation (Priority 9), Market Leadership Initiative (Priority 9), Expansion Strategy (Priority 8)
Risk Assessment: Overall Risk 41.5%, Execution Risk 38.3%, Market Risk 45.0%
Key Recommendations: Solid position - focus on selective improvements and growth. Invest in innovation and market expansion.

best_practices: Define the strategic problem clearly before applying frameworks to ensure focused analysis
Use multiple frameworks (SWOT, Porter, BCG) to cross-validate strategic insights
Base recommendations on quantified metrics rather than qualitative opinions alone
anti_patterns: Using frameworks without adapting them to your specific industry and context
Over-relying on single data points rather than triangulating multiple sources
Skipping stakeholder input when developing strategic recommendations

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance for all platforms without requiring specific tool integrations.

faq.question: What are the input limits for financial modeling?
faq.answer: The Python scripts handle standard financial scenarios. Complex models with 100+ variables may require manual breakdown into smaller calculations.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: This is a standalone advisory skill. It provides frameworks you apply manually or use with your preferred financial and productivity tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: All analysis runs locally in your session. No data is transmitted externally. Python scripts only perform calculations without network access.

faq.question: Why are my projections different from expected?
faq.answer: Financial models use simplified assumptions. Review your input parameters and consider industry-specific factors not captured in standard models.

faq.question: How does this compare to consultant recommendations?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured frameworks used by professional consultants. It offers starting points for analysis rather than replacing expert judgment for major decisions.
